title: Whining at players for not having better net services
body:
Just another common remark players make for the sake of being obnoxious as sore losers, regardless of how blatantly idiotic the remark is. There are apartment complexes that don't allow alternate services to the ones the complexes provide. There are towns/regions monopolized by certain net services, and good competing services don't exist (the be all and end all of why Time Warner gets away with so much crap). There are also people with these things called budgets.

No, I'm not moving just to make a few occasional League games better, and I won't dish out cash just because you can't stand games where allies aren't carrying you. If you haven't noticed, "f2p" doesn't stand for "pay to play". Get a grip on priorities and not being an ass in chat. When everything else works well enough, League can suffer a few lag issues. I don't care if I lose a few games to allies with net issues, and neither should you. It's life, and this is just a game. Get over it people.

replies.body:
It is simply not fair to place blame on a player for their internet connections.  I worked in the industry.  There are things within it that are simply out of the customer's hands.  But that's not to say the user does not have options.

A quick tip.  You, as the consumer, to have every right to press the issue with your ISP that your connection is sub par.  They are the one providing the connection for you, after all.  Granted, you cannot just stop paying them because they can then stop your service.  But you can complain to them and other businesses to make things happen.  And if your landlord refuses to allow upgrades such as new wiring for your apartment, there are things you can do there as well.  Know your rights.

Still, there is some frustration associated with someone who keeps being disconnected.  But the most I will ever tell someone in that case is "You need a new ISP."

You're right that sometimes you don't have a choice in what kind of connection you have, but people that have bad connections still have the choice of whether or not to play multiplayer games where their connection is important.

> You're right that sometimes you don't have a choice in what kind of connection you have, but people that have bad connections still have the choice of whether or not to play multiplayer games where their connection is important.

They sure do, and since it's a choice they have every right to choose to play if they want. League has system requirements. If you meet them, you can play. Simple as that. Same as people with good internet can choose not to play. If they have any issue with anything that anyone does regardless of how much, how small, or how big. If you have an issue, you can leave. The people not having fun are the ones who should go because I can have more fun with a person lagging so bad that they can't function who has a good attitude about it than the guy who rages at him for it. That's the guy I never want to play with again, and you best believe I report it.

That is how people have been programmed and why we have the problems we have. Playing on a bullshit connection is telling me that you only care about yourself and that's it. You are passive to everything in your life and part of the problem not the solution.

Yes, you also have a choice. Should I play with a shitty connection and ruin the experience for everyone I play with or should I just not play and not subject total strangers to my BS connection so as to not waste their time. 

IMO, anyone who purposely negatively affects others through their actions is not worth the dirt on the bottom of my shoe. IDGAF what they are doing.

So you can have your opinion and I have mine. Have a nice day.

I'll be straight up with you. I was reading your opinion and taking your thoughts into consideration until I got to this part "You are passive to everything in your life and part of the problem not the solution." At that point I stopped bothering to read it, I'll tell you why. You presume to understand who I am as a person. I'll let you know now that I am anything but passive, in fact I'm extremely proactive in my life. If there is a problem, issue, or simply something that irritates me I immediately address it and deal with it. If you're going to try to prove a point (especially if you plan to do so in a hateful manner) you should be very sure that what you are saying about the psyche of the person you are talking to is actually true. Don't just throw an insult because you think it will be offensive. You killed your own validity with it since I do legitimately know what kind of person I am, and therefore know out the gate that you are just guessing. I assume all your information comes from guesses resulting in you not having an opinion, just a series of words smashed together for the sake of someone listening to you, most likely for attention alone. In fact, anyone who posts on this board are proactive people to at least a small degree since they are participating, common sense would dictate that knowledge. Having said that, I'll now say this. You were right about me being a selfish person. I totally am, I've never denied that to myself or anyone else. I'm perfectly fine with it. I'm not going to not have fun so some stranger can be happy. When left to decide if I should be happy or you should be happy, well, I'm going with me every time. If you don't like it come unplug my computer. Short of that, the only power you have is the power you obtain via illusion of idol claims which few people will actually fall for. Next time, just calmly and nicely post your opinions, maybe I'll actually read the second half of your post that way. To be noted, I will only correct toxic people once. After that, you are talking to yourself.

Don't care who you are and I find it very funny that you actually have to try and defend yourself to a total stranger. Insecurity issues? Probably big time. My opinion is about all people who feel the way you do and find nothing wrong with wasting others time. There is only one meaning for that and it's self absorption. You are useless in my world as I have stated and even more so now that you found the need to try and justify it, lol. Thanks for making me smile today though.
That said, would you take your small oar boat into a raging storm?

Would you die from playing a League game with lag?

This is what I mean by priorities. The fact that anyone would think that a life-threatening-storm analogy is even remotely apt for the conversation just goes to show how idiotic and jaded people in this community are.

and that is the problem with the community, every one treats league like a basic right. It is free to play so I/everyone should play and not worry about my X issues. This problem ranges from the kid that has to go to bed in 20 minutes, to the people with medical issues(like depression), and people that do not have sufficient hardware/internet systems. 

But i can watch you tube so the problem is not muh interent, BAH.
It's not that hard. If someone is lagging, don't say anything. People are just...difficult though.

Good point. Amazingly most people won't care or notice, given that half of players play as crappy with good internet as without. One other thing to add to my growing list of reasons to disable in-game chat. It's so useless.
Cool story. Enjoy your leaverbuster ban if your Internet sucks so much.
There is no reason to whine or rage about it, just report them afk and move on. Leaverbuster will handle it. If its a rare occurrence nothing will happen, if its common they will be punished.
